intro: Croton fianarantsoae var. ranomafanae, commonly known as the Ranomafana croton, is a species native to the rainforests of Madagascar. It is characterized by its striking, brightly colored leaves that often display a mix of red, yellow, and green hues. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, known for its diverse and often ornamental species. It typically grows as an understory shrub, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
